website_summaries.verdict: This stylish helmet gives you safety and plenty of options.
pros: ThinShell design strikes a balance between hard ABS or polycarbonate shell thickness and interior EPS foam thickness
Meets Safety Certifications CPSC, EN1077B, EN1078
Kits available to convert for winter warmth, sold separately
Holes included to accommodate lights, also sold separately
cons: Some users felt that the helmet can get a bit too warm

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is wrong...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Large helmet because my boyfriend has the same exact helmet and it has the L-XL sticker on the inside. When I got the L helmet I ordered, it was HUGE! It was too big for my boyfriend's head too. I went to an actual bike store that carried these helmets and the proper size that matched my boyfriend's L-XL helmet was a Medium! I have no idea what's going on with their sizing, but definitely go to a store because their sizing is all over the place..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How do you tell the size?
customer_reviews.text: Okay. So I had the same problem that you do. What is S-M-L-XL? Just what is that size? So I have a 7 3/8 head. That's what my Yankee fitted cap is that fits perfectly, so I wanted a helmet the same size. I tried XL/L. No. I tried L. No. Then I tried M - Medium. And that was a perfect 7 3/8 size. I hope this helps. This is a great helmet, and I get compliments on it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Thegze

customer_reviews.title: Fits like summer liner from old S/M helmets
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the old non-adjustable S/M helmets from Bern from 2013. Given the current political climate in my city, I decided my head could use some updated protection these days! I was only able to wear the S/M with the thick winter liner, otherwise it was too big. This one fits me perfectly with the liner it ships with. It feels breezy and a lot more secure, too. I love the adjustment dial. Looking forward to lots of biking and sign-waving!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

I have never had a skateboard or urban style helmet before. This helmet even all the way tight, still does not fit snug on my head.

customer_reviews.title: A Little too Small, but . . .
customer_reviews.text: I measured my head before purchasing this helmet and ordered the corresponding size on the size chart. It is however, somewhat small -- somewhat meaning "just a little" -- little enough that the next size up, I would imagine, to be too large. So, I will stay with this size and hope, over time, it conforms more to my head. If not, I will remove the band and find a smaller pad to affix to the inside perimeter. Otherwise it's a great helmet and much more stylish than the ordinary weird looking bike helmets. This helmet also has fewer holes than the ordinary bike helmet -- which means fewer places for bees and other bugs to enter.

product_meta.title: Bern - Summer Watts EPS Helmet
product_meta.description: The Watts is Bern's blue-collar special. With a baseball-hat-inspired hard visor, true all-season versatility, and classic Bern styling, the Watts is at home on the morning commute, during the evening two-wheeled beer run, at the ski area, and on the bike path. Featuring our Crank Fit dial adjustable fit system, tried and true EPS/ABS construction, and a moisture-controlling premium liner, the Watts fits, looks, and feels great. The Watts also passes both bike and snow safety certifications, making this a true all-season lid!
feature_bullets: Replaceable ZipMold warm and cold weather liner.
Easily add our PDW Bike Light which quickly attaches to the helmet or add a cold or warm weather ZipMold liner to bike and ski all year long.
STYLE - The baseball-hat-inspired hard visor with classic Bern styling looks and feels at home no matter where your sport takes you.

COMFORT - Featuring our Crank Fit dial adjustable fit system, tried and true EPS/ABS construction, and a moisture-controlling premium liner, the Watts fits and feels great. Air channels pull air through front vents and allow air to exit through back vents.

PROTECTION - ABS shell with EPS hard foam provides reliable protection in a low-profile design. Meets ASTM F 2040 and EN 1077B standards for snow and ski, CPSC and EN 1078 standards for bike and skate.
